sentences: Angham Mohamed Ali Suleiman (Arabic: أنغام محمد علي سليمان; born 19 January 1972), known by the mononym Angham (Arabic: أنغام), is an Egyptian singer, recording artist, and actress.
section: N/A

sentences: Her debut was in 1987 under the guidance of her father, Mohammad Suleiman.
section: N/A

sentences: Following her divorce from Magdy Aref in 2000, Angham took much more control over her image and musical style after that Leih Sebtaha (Why Did You Leave Her) record established her into a strong position amid the constant emerge of new voices in the Middle East music scene.
section: N/A

sentences: After a highly publicized feud between Alam El Phan Music Records' president Mohsen Gaber and the artist, She moved to another record company, Rotana.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2005, She released the album Bahibbik Wahashteeny (I Love You, I Miss You).
section: N/A

sentences: It was critically acclaimed, but commercially was not as expected.
section: N/A

sentences: After three years, Angham returned to the forefront of Arabic pop music in 2007 with her album Kolma N'arrab (Whenever We Come Closer) which sold more than 500,000 CDs across the Middle East in less than three months and was awarded a platinum certification.
section: N/A

== Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Angham was born in Alexandria, Egypt, the eldest child of Mohammad Suleiman, a former violinist, music composer, orchestra chief, and singer, while her mother, Mageda Abdel Haleem, is a well-known artist.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: She grew up in aMuslim family.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: The family moved to Cairo by the late 1990s, and settled down at elMohandiseen Street, an avenue reputated for having many celebrities as residents.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Angham has three siblings.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Her brother, Khaled, is studying music arrangements.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Owing to his physical handicap, Angham kept her third sibling, Ahmad, away from the spotlight and his identity and whereabouts remain anonymous to this day.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Angham began singing at around the age of sixteen, and her uncle, Emad Abdel Haleem, began teaching her how to present herself to an audience.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Angham performed for the first time in public during Cairo's Radio syndicate ceremony because they were looking for new voices to artistically adopt them.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: She sang "elGennah Taht Akdamek" (Paradise Is Under Your Feet) as a dedication to the mothers who were present during the concert.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: She recalled how her father was not pleased with her performance and that his negative attitude was the major force that propelled her in a battle between her talents and her inner self to come up with better songs.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: On "Maa Hobby" (With Love) talk show in 2005, host Joumana Bou Eid asked Angham how she felt toward her dad after eight years of collaboration in making records.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Angham replied "that she owe him many things and that she is lucky he is her father and an important figure in the music industry at the same time".
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: The publicity of Angham's separation from her father whether on a personal or artistic level stabilized Angham's independent entrance into the industry of music.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Angham only attended high school.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Upon its completion, Angham moved to Cairo's Conservatory of Music.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: She studied the basics of the music, improved her voice's capacities, and learned how to play on the traditional piano and Oud.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: However, Angham fell into a nervous breakdown when she received news about her uncle's death which happened on the same day of her first tour in Tunisia at the Carthage International Festival.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Months before "Bet'heb Meen" (Who Do You love) record's release in 1999, Angham married Magdy Aref, an Egyptian businessman and music video director, from whom she gave birth to a boy named Omar.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Angham's father was strongly against his daughter's choice of husband, but the artist married Magdy without her father's approval.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: In 2000, their divorce caused a riot in the press who criticized Angham's lack of experience in managing to keep her records unaffected by her private life.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: They added that she was too young for a step like it.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Angham remained a single mom for four years before she finally met music arrangist Fahd and became romantically involved during the making of her 2003 record Omry Maak.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: In April 2004, they were married in a huge ceremony on "The Place" yacht in 2004.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Their love relationship was built over many years and they were spotted together on many occasions.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: In 2003, the press rumored that Angham married him secretly.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Likewise, her publicly viewed marriage ended this rumour.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Among the invitees present at the wedding were artists Elissa, Sherine, Mohamed Hamaki, Khaled Agag, Sheriff Makkawy, and Ehab Toufic.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Rotana Records company's president, Salem elHindy, and his spokesperson, Tony Semaan, attended the wedding.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: Angham's father and son, Omar, chose not to attend her wedding.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: In December 2005, Angham gave birth to Abdel Rahman.
section: == Life and music career == | === Childhood and youth ===

sentences: However, the marriage did not last long and Angham divorced Fahd in June 2008.

== Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: Angham's eighteenth studio album, Kolma N'arrab (Whenever We Come Closer), was released in 2007 and contained contributions from music composers such as Khaled Ezz, Tamer Ali, Ramy Gamal, Baleegh Hamdy and Sheriff Tagg.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: After criticisms that Angham is over-using her ex-husband to rearrange the tracks in "Omry Maak" and "Bahibbik Wahashteeny" ("I Love You, I Miss You") records, Angham collaborated with a variety of music arrangers.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: They include: Fahd, Tarek Madkour, Walid Fayad, Ashraf Mahrous, Tamim and Essam elSharayty.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: The record features a remake of "Ashky Lmeen" (Who Can I Complain To) as a tribute to Mohamed Mounir.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: Angham is the first female artist to include a remake in her record for a living artist.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: Kolma N'arrab became the best-selling record for a female artist in the Middle East in 2007.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: A reviewer for Almotamar (The Conference) concluded that Angham is the best-selling female artist during summer 2007, beating sales of Lebanese artists Nancy Ajram and Najwa Karam.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: The record earned Angham a platinum certification.

sentences: and was directed by Ahmad elMahdy, peaked on rank one at Rotana Top 20 chart on 25 August 2007.

sentences: "Dah Elly Indi Track" peaked at rank two at Radio Orient chart in France, while "Kolma N'arrab" track peaked on rank one on 6 August 2007, at "Eftekasat Top 10 Songs of the Week" chart.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: Angham won Best Egyptian Female Artist award in 2007 officially given to her by the Nile Entertainment channel.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: Angham began a series of televised appearances to promote her record.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: She appeared on X-Factor at Rotana, "Nejm elNoujoum" (Star of the Stars) in Kuwait, Studio 2M in Morocco and "Maa Hobbi" ("With Love") in Lebanon.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: She debuted her first tour with a successful performance in Cairo at the "Layali elTelevision" (Nights of the Television) concert on 14 July 2007, which took part at the Chinese Garden, amid a young demographic which surpassed 3000 in number.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: Kolma N'arrab has been nominated for Best Selling Record at the World Music Award 2007 alongside Amr Diab and Nancy Ajram.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: On 3 February 2008, she appeared for the second time on Taratata to honour Egyptian artist, Mohammad Mounir, alongside artists Zein elOmar, Hussein and Houda Haddad.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: She took part with Syrian singer Asala in the first live airing of "elArrab" (The Mentor) show in its first cycle, hosted by Nichan Deirharotonian.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: The artist recorded an episode for "Inta Meen" ("Who Are You") programme, hosted by Nadine Fallah on Abou Dhabi Channel.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: Angham was invited to the "10th Hour" show on Dream channel on the second January 2008.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: According to Elaph E-newspaper, Angham will continue her tour and her third concert around the Middle East is due to take place at the Doha's 9th Music Festival, where she will be closing the event alongside Gulf legend artist Mohammad Abdo on 29 January 2008.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

sentences: The concert was a phenomenal success and tabloids acclaimed Angham for her appearance.
section: == Life and music career == | === 2007–2008: Return to stardom ===

== Acting career ==

sentences: Acting career ==
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: Angham began to take professional acting lessons in 2000.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: She made her debut as an actress in the romantic comedy Leila Men Alf Leila (Night of a Thousand Nights) starring prominent actor Yehia elFakharany, actor/artist Ali elHajjar, Sleem Sahab band, and the Cairo Opera House ballet.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: It was produced by the Cairo Opera House in Egypt.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: Angham's first acting project was huge, but did not continue for more than two months, and was not aired on television.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: Angham's second acting experience was with Ali elHajjar again in the theatrical drama Rossassa fil Alb (Bullet Right in the Heart).
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: The plot was written by Toufic Hakeem and was originally intended for theatre before it was transformed in the 1940s into a movie which starred actor/artist Mohammed Abdel Wahab and actress Rakiya Ibrahim.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: Angham loved both experiences, but said to Middle East Newspaper:
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: I benefited from these two experiences a lot, but standing on the stage is a very tiring job, which forces the artist to leave lots of other things including his personal and professional life as a singer to be able to fully focus on it.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: This was the sole point that I did not like in the acting experience.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: Rossassa fil Alb is Angham's most successful acting experience, and many movie offers came later for her.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: However, she did not accept them because she wanted to focus on her singing career.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: Among the offers she refused were Sahar elLayali (Sleepless Nights) which was nominated for Best Foreign Movie at the Academy Awards in 2003, in which the singer was supposed to act instead of actress Mona Zaki, Shiqet Maser elJadida (Heliopolis Apartment)], Aan elAshk Wel Hawa (About Love and Passion)] elShoumouaa elSawdaa (Black Candles)] where she was supposedly to remake the acting part of legend actress/artist Najat elSagheera, and Hayat Thekra (Life of Thekra) where Angham was supposedly to remake the life of assassinated Tunisian singer, Thekra.
section: == Acting career ==

section: == Artistry ==
== Artistry == | === Voice ===

sentences: Voice =
section: == Artistry == | === Voice ===
== Artistry == | === Voice ===

sentences: Angham has said that from childhood she was influenced by Arabic classics and soul musicians such as Mohammed Abdel Wahab, Fairuz and Umm Kulthum.
section: == Artistry == | === Voice ===

sentences: Her music contains strong influences of gospel urban contemporary music, Arabic classics, R&B, waltz and lately reggaeton.
section: == Artistry == | === Voice ===

sentences: Angham is said to be able to cover all the notes from alto vocal range to six-octave vocal range.
section: == Artistry == | === Voice ===

sentences: In her early years, she attempted to emulate Fairuz's simple notes, to ensure an efficient way of communication emotions.
section: == Artistry == | === Voice ===

sentences: In Maa Hobby (With Love) talk show, Angham said that "singing in a low voice is far much more difficult than screaming in high pitch notes.
section: == Artistry == | === Voice ===

sentences: There are not so many artists today that are capable of doing so."
section: == Artistry == | === Voice ===

sentences: Angham's vocal trademark is her ability to sing in the whistle register and to transfer true emotions through her songs.
section: == Artistry == | === Voice ===
